analysis:
Timeline: Decide in 1-4 weeks. Time to learn.
Reversibility: You can partly undo this. Be balanced.
✓ You have complete information. Decision should be more definitive.
Constraints: Limited team capacity right now, Authentication is critical to security, New features are also high priority, No budget for additional hiring
recommended_approach:
Plan reversibility explicitly, test, have backup plan

For this timeline:
• Design small experiments to reduce uncertainty
• Talk to relevant people
• Build prototype/mock/simulation
• Let learnings guide decision
key_questions: What's my contingency if this fails?
What happens if I'm wrong about this decision?
What would I need to know to feel 80% confident?
Can I test this assumption before committing fully?
What's the worst case if this goes wrong?
What's the best case if this goes right?
How would I know if I made a good decision? (measurement)
Is the timing right for this decision now?
What patterns from past decisions apply here?
success_patterns: Modular Design: Break into independent pieces
Honest Measurement: Track actual vs. expected
